instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
Its water damaged board and there is no green light.
pp3v42 is 3.56 volts and i am getting smc_bc_acok and sys_onewire signals on respected chips but i still don't get green light on charger, i have tried reflowing smc but still nothing happened.


What else should I try?

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
SMC_RESET_L has correct level?
Post exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H.
Also check voltages for U6900/01.

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
Smc reset have 3.5volts
and u6901 have 3.5 on pin 1,4,5
u6990 have 3.5 on 1,2,4,5

can it be because pp3v42 is 3.58 instead on 3.42?

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
Change battery of your multimeter and test again.
Low battery causes higher readings...

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
I think its probably dead, there was explosion on firewire circuit, and it has destroyed many traces underneath that chip
and there is short on 3v3s0 line aswell

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message: You didn't tell anything about PPBUS_G3H, but this really looks like dead board reading your last post...

threads.title: 820-3115-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message: I managed to restore ppbus and it was around 12.30volts and green light did came up for few minutes but then i saw broken traces in second or third layer and a short in s0 rail, so i declared it dead
